msItem.title: Tuzuk-i Timuri.
msItem.note: The high quality of the script suggests that the MS was intended for presentation, perhaps to Muhammad Shah, but the intention was never fully carried out. Folio one, recto: Tuzuk-i Timuriyya bi-khatt-i Shirin-raqam (presumably the name of the scribe). Last page after end of text, verso: abjad alphabet with corresponding numerals. Inside back cover: crested bookplate of N.B. Edmonstone. (For Neil Benjamin Edmonstone see Buckland.) Institutes of Timur. A very brief selection from Mir Abu Talib's supposed translation of the spurious memoirs made by someone in the service of the Mughal Emperor Muhammad Shah. (Ff, 2a, 3a) Authorship is falsely attributed to Timur. Gold-sprinkled paper is used for the first sixteen folios. A few gaps left, probably intended to be filled in coloured inks.
msItem.incipit: Dar in waqt kih himmat-i haqq-tuwiyyat

listBibl.bibl: For Edmonstone's bequest see the donations register under November 6 1841, p. 408 and J.R.A.S., viii, Annual Report, p. x, Proceedings, p. xxxi.

bindingDesc.p: European half-leather binding with some blind tooling.

origin.p: Presumably in the reign of the Mughal Emperor Muhammad Shah.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
